Machine

The Machine module implements a node in a distributed system using a logical clock.

Machine Class

class src.machine.Machine(id, host, port, neighbors, clock_rate_range=(1, 6), internal_work_probability=0.7)[source]

Bases: object

A class representing a machine in a distributed system implementing a logical clock.

This class manages message passing between machines, maintains a logical clock, and logs events (internal, send, receive) with both system time and logical clock values.

Variables:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the machine

  • host (str) – Host address the machine runs on

  • port (int) – Port number the machine listens on

  • neighbors (list) – List of (host, port) tuples representing neighbor machines

  • clock (int) – Current value of the logical clock

  • clock_rate (int) – Random rate (1-6) at which the machine’s clock ticks

  • running (bool) – Flag indicating if the machine is running

  • message_queue (Queue) – Queue for storing incoming messages

  • log_file (file) – File handle for logging events

  • internal_work_probability (float) – Probability between 0-1 that machine performs internal work.

Start the network server for this machine.

Initializes a TCP server socket that listens for incoming connections and handles incoming messages.

Log an event with system time, machine ID, logical clock, and event details.

  • detail (str) – Detailed description of the event

main_loop()[source]
run()[source]

Start the machine’s operation.

Initializes the network server and enters the main processing loop. The machine will run for 60 seconds before shutting down.

Event Types

The machine handles three types of events:

  • INTERNAL: Internal events that only affect the local machine

  • SEND: Events where the machine sends a message to another machine

  • RECEIVE: Events where the machine receives a message from another machine

Message Format

Messages are formatted as strings with fields separated by ‘|’:

sender_id|sender_timestamp|message_content

Logging Format

Each log entry follows this format:

[SystemTime=<time>] [Machine=<id>] [LogicalClock=<clock>] [Event=<type>] <detail>

Example Usage

from src.machine import Machine

# Create a machine instance
machine = Machine(
    id=1,
    host="localhost",
    port=8765,
    neighbors=[("localhost", 8766), ("localhost", 8767)],
    clock_rate_min=1,
    clock_rate_max=6,
    internal_work_prob=0.7,
)

# Start the machine
machine.run()
